attributes.action: No to the national insurance rises for the lower paid and younger workers.
attributes.additional_details:
Tax the wealthy more and stop penalising the working class people of this country. We should we the common man face the bill for your years of misspending and ill preparation.
For those earning £15,000, your NI would increase by £54 a year.
If Brits earn a salary of £25,000 your NI would rise by £154 a year.
If you earn £35,000 your tax bill would increase by £254 a year.
If you are on a salary of, £50,000 it would go up by £404.
Earning £75,000 will see a £654 yearly increase to their NI bill.
attributes.background: Why should the younger workers and lower paid be forced to pay higher rates of national insurance to cover the burden of the NHS. Throughout the period of austerity, we have all had to make sacrifices to our spending due to cuts etc. Enough is enough.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/596280
